forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 65. West wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle between 11pm and 5am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
This afternoon, Downtown San Francisco bathes in a comforting warmth, a serene 65 degrees wrapped in sunshine, brief wisps of clouds daring to interrupt the endless blue. The steady west wind rustles through the trees at a gentle 18 miles per hour, hinting at the spirited dance of the city—an invitation to step outside and savor the day. As the sun begins its slow descent, the air retains a pleasant crispness, making it a perfect time for a leisurely walk along the waterfront or through the twisting streets of the Mission. The likelihood of drizzle tonight is slight, a mere 20 percent, providing just enough uncertainty to add a tinge of excitement to your evening plans. 

As dusk arrives, the charm of the partially cloudy sky offers an enchanting backdrop to a dinner al fresco. With a light jacket handy, you can embrace the coolness settling in with the night, ideal for a gathering with friends at an outdoor café. Though some nuances of fog may linger close to the shore, Downtown’s current visibility is quite pleasing. Should the mystique of the City by the Bay call to you this evening, contemplate your next move as the wisps of the marine layer retreat, allowing for a night richly imbued with San Francisco’s captivating atmosphere.
